name: Kepler-730
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-730 Exoplanetary System


Overview

Kepler-730 is a star with 1.05 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.41 times its radius. It is located 6589.00 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 9.5 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

Kepler-730 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the Kepler-730 system


Kepler-730 b

Kepler-730 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.07 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The radius of Kepler-730 b is 12.33 that of Earth.


Kepler-730 c

Kepler-730 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.04 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The radius of Kepler-730 c is 1.569 that of Earth.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-730, which contains 2 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
